title: Embroidered Picture, 1929-16-1, 18th century
inscribed: Inscriptions:  above, "Simchas Bais Hasho'eva" (The Joy of the Ceremony of the Drawing of Water). Bottom center: "The Form of Zidah"; right, "Pious Man"; left, "Distinguished man".
creditline: Gift of The Ehrich Galleries, in memory of Mrs. Louis R. Ehrich
description: Picture shows a scene in Jewish ritual celebration:  "The Feast of the Drawing of  Water."  In the back are three arches: in the center a  hanging candelabra, on the left, a man playing the tambourine, on the right a  man playing a horn. In the foreground are three figures, all of same man-- Rabban Simeon-- performing different acts of rejoicing.  Embroidered in pale silks, metal thread and paillettes on cream-colored taffeta.
